American Indian and Alaskan Native Documents in the Congressional Serial Set, 1817-1899.
University of Oklahoma College of Law Digital Commons,

"These facsimile United States government documents were assembled from the Oklahoma Department of Libraries print collection and scanned at the University of Oklahoma Donald E Pray Law Library... Individuals responsible for creating the database are Marilyn K Nicely, Retired Law Librarian for Native American Digitization at the University of Oklahoma Law Library ... together with Steve Beleu."
Searchable database which provides free access to in-depth full text government documents of political, military, and governmental activities related to American Indians and Alaskan Natives.
Description based on contents viewed on Dec. 6, 2019; title from home page.
